comments:
oaw-classic, version 4.1 final, method 
private void checkContraints(Element element, boolean secondTime)
in Class org.openarchitectureware.core.constraint.MetaEnvironmentConstraintsChecker:
In case an Exception is thrown when trying to invoke checkConstraints(), the Element causing the Exception and full stack-trace should be logged, probably before(!) the call to Checks.error().
Reason: At least in my case, Checks.error() throws an exception itself, leaving you with no hint where the original problem was.
See the stack-trace I get below.

9469 ERROR - class not set!
org.openarchitectureware.core.meta.core.ModelIncompleteException: class not set!
	at org.openarchitectureware.core.meta.core.Element.reportModelIncomplete(Element.java:110)
	at org.openarchitectureware.meta.uml.classifier.AttributeBase.Class(AttributeBase.java:482)
	at org.openarchitectureware.meta.uml.classifier.Attribute.getLocation(Attribute.java:52)
	at org.openarchitectureware.core.debug.errorAndDebug.GeneratorMessageDesc.<init>(GeneratorMessageDesc.java:51)
	at org.openarchitectureware.core.debug.errorAndDebug.ErrorDesc.<init>(ErrorDesc.java:37)
	at org.openarchitectureware.core.debug.errorAndDebug.ContextBoundErrorDesc.<init>(ContextBoundErrorDesc.java:38)
	at org.openarchitectureware.core.constraint.ChecksDefaultReportingStrategy.error(ChecksDefaultReportingStrategy.java:41)
	at org.openarchitectureware.core.constraint.Checks.error(Checks.java:291)
	at org.openarchitectureware.core.constraint.MetaEnvironmentConstraintsChecker.checkContraints(MetaEnvironmentConstraintsChecker.java:243)
	at org.openarchitectureware.core.constraint.MetaEnvironmentConstraintsChecker.checkContraintsForAllElements(MetaEnvironmentConstraintsChecker.java:182)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.oawclassic.ModelChecker.invoke(ModelChecker.java:33)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.container.CompositeComponent.internalInvoke(CompositeComponent.java:74)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.container.CompositeComponent.invoke(CompositeComponent.java:64)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.container.CompositeComponent.internalInvoke(CompositeComponent.java:74)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.container.CompositeComponent.invoke(CompositeComponent.java:64)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.container.CompositeComponent.internalInvoke(CompositeComponent.java:74)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.container.CompositeComponent.invoke(CompositeComponent.java:64)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.WorkflowRunner.executeWorkflow(WorkflowRunner.java:222)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.WorkflowRunner.run(WorkflowRunner.java:162)
	at org.openarchitectureware.workflow.WorkflowRunner.main(WorkflowRunner.java:115)

The problematic code is in the constructor of GeneratorMessageDesc. It calls getLocation(), which may fail with a RuntimeException (in this case a ModelIncompleteException). This should not lead to failures when cosntructing a GeneratorMessageDesc instance. It should just lead to leaving the 'location' property empty. 

Added a static method getLocation() which calls fail-safe the getLocation() method for an element. If a RuntimeException occurs it prints the stack trace.

Changed:
GeneratorMessageDesc 1.3
